instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: Boots directly into DFU MODE /STUCK IN DFU
threads.message: good day guys , please I would like to understand this concept, am having two separate machines have started to experience this , one was an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and the other one is an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, is this caused by the T2 itself or its PMIC?  Please guys , am not looking for a specific solution, I would like to understand it , then I can formulate my solution around it, thank you guys as always.

threads.title: Boots directly into DFU MODE /STUCK IN DFU
threads.message:
The machines have been touched by someone else before?
DFU ends in error?

threads.title: Boots directly into DFU MODE /STUCK IN DFU
threads.message: Yes : SSD was replaced on one , so what did, was I removed all the SSD chips , but board still boots directly into dfu

threads.title: Boots directly into DFU MODE /STUCK IN DFU
threads.message:
On a side note : Does the machine booting into DFU signifies that all
<CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> are in working conditions? In other words, if I have 5V across but am able to boot the machine into DFU , does this means , my issue isn’t at the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> level ?

threads.title: Boots directly into DFU MODE /STUCK IN DFU
threads.message:
Touching NAND chips, is a good reason to boot into DFU.
Did you try DFU restore?
